definitions: reach a conclusion by reasoning from available evidence or known facts
examples: Scientists deduced the age of the fossil from surrounding rock layers
The detective deduced who committed the crime from witness statements

definitions: subtract or take away an amount from a total especially for calculation
examples: The company deducts taxes from every employee's monthly paycheck
Please deduct the discount before calculating the final price

definitions: make something deeper by digging or extending downward into it
become or make more intense profound or serious in nature
examples: Workers deepened the harbor to accommodate larger ships
The construction crew deepened the foundation before building
Their friendship deepened after years of working together
The economic crisis deepened as unemployment rates continued rising

definitions: discharge feces from the body through the bowels as natural process
examples: Most healthy adults defecate once or twice each day
The doctor asked about how often the patient defecates

definitions: desert one's country or cause in favor of an opposing one
examples: The diplomat defected to a neighboring country seeking political asylum
Several soldiers defected from the army during the civil war

definitions: put off an action or event to a later time than originally planned
submit to another person's wishes opinion or judgment out of respect
examples: The committee deferred the decision until next month's meeting
Students can defer their loan payments while still in school
I defer to your expertise on this technical matter
The young lawyer deferred to her senior partner's judgment

definitions: damage the purity or appearance of something by making it dirty or polluted
examples: Vandals defiled the ancient temple with spray paint graffiti
Industrial waste defiled the once pristine river for decades

definitions: cause something to change direction by hitting or blocking it
avoid dealing with something by directing attention elsewhere
examples: The goalkeeper deflected the ball with his outstretched hand
The shield deflected arrows during the medieval battle
Politicians often deflect difficult questions during press conferences
She deflected criticism by changing the subject quickly

definitions: clear an area of land of trees especially on a large scale
examples: Companies deforested thousands of acres for agricultural development
The region was deforested to make room for cattle ranching

definitions: distort the shape or form of something making it misshapen or abnormal
examples: High heat deformed the plastic container beyond recognition
The accident deformed the car's front bumper and hood

definitions: illegally obtain money from someone by deception or trickery
examples: The accountant defrauded investors of millions through fake records
Scammers defrauded elderly victims by pretending to be relatives

definitions: provide money to pay all or part of costs or expenses
examples: Donations helped defray the cost of the charity event
The scholarship will defray some of her college tuition expenses

definitions: remove the fuse from an explosive device or reduce tension in situation
examples: The bomb squad carefully defused the explosive device
Her calm words defused the tense situation between coworkers

definitions: openly resist or refuse to obey someone or something with boldness
examples: Teenagers often defy their parents' rules and curfews
The protestors defied the government's ban on public gatherings

definitions: decline or deteriorate physically mentally or morally to a worse state
examples: The political debate degenerated into personal attacks and shouting
Without maintenance the building degenerated into a dangerous structure

definitions: reduce something in quality value or strength over time
treat someone in a way that makes them feel worthless
examples: Sunlight degrades plastic products left outside for years
Pollution degrades the air quality in major cities
The bully degraded his classmates with cruel remarks
Some advertisements degrade women by portraying harmful stereotypes

definitions: entrust a task or responsibility to another person typically subordinate
examples: The manager delegates routine tasks to her assistant
Good leaders know how to delegate responsibilities effectively

definitions: engage in long and careful consideration before reaching a decision
examples: The jury deliberated for three days before reaching their verdict
The committee will deliberate on the proposal next week

definitions: please someone greatly or give them great pleasure and satisfaction
examples: The magician's tricks delighted children at the birthday party
Fresh flowers always delight her when she receives them

definitions: determine or fix the limits or boundaries of something clearly
examples: The surveyor delimited the property lines with wooden stakes
The contract clearly delimits each party's responsibilities and obligations

definitions: describe or portray something precisely in words or gestures
examples: The report delineates the steps needed for project completion
The teacher delineated the differences between similar historical events

definitions: overwhelm someone or something with a great quantity of things
examples: Fans deluged the celebrity with requests for autographs
The company was deluged with complaints after the service outage

definitions: reach inside something or research deeply into a subject
examples: Historians delve into archives to uncover forgotten stories
The journalist delved into the politician's financial records

definitions: set the boundaries or limits of something with clear markers
examples: Yellow tape demarcates the crime scene from public areas
The treaty demarcated the border between the two countries

definitions: die or come to an end especially of something once successful
examples: The king demised peacefully in his sleep last night
Poor management led to the company's eventual demise

definitions: give a demonstration of how something works or what it does
examples: The salesperson will demo the new software this afternoon
Let me demo this feature before you purchase the product

definitions: pull or knock down a building or destroy something completely
examples: Workers demolished the old factory to build new apartments
The hurricane demolished several coastal homes last year

definitions: be a sign of or indicate something specific in meaning
examples: Red traffic lights denote that drivers must stop completely
The symbol denotes peace in many cultures around the world

definitions: publicly declare to be wrong or evil typically in formal statement
examples: Human rights groups denounced the government's violent crackdown
The senator denounced corruption in a passionate speech yesterday

definitions: make a hollow or depression in a surface by impact
examples: The shopping cart dented my car door in the parking lot
Heavy hail dented the roof of several houses

definitions: leave especially to start a journey to another place
examples: The train departs from platform three at noon
We need to depart early to avoid traffic jams

definitions: use up the supply or resources of something significantly
examples: Overfishing depletes ocean fish populations faster than reproduction
Marathon running depletes the body's energy stores quickly

definitions: expel a foreigner from a country typically for legal reasons
examples: The government deported hundreds of undocumented workers last month
Authorities will deport anyone who overstays their visa

definitions: remove someone from office suddenly and forcefully especially a ruler
examples: The military coup deposed the president after mass protests
Shareholders voted to depose the CEO following financial scandals

definitions: make someone feel extremely sad and without hope or enthusiasm
push or pull something down to a lower position
examples: The rainy weather depresses many people during winter months
News of layoffs depressed employee morale throughout the company
Depress the brake pedal slowly when coming to a stop
The nurse depressed the plunger to inject the medicine

definitions: deny someone the possession or use of something important to them
examples: The court deprived him of custody rights after the incident
Poverty deprives millions of children of proper education worldwide

definitions: appoint someone to act as a deputy or representative
examples: The manager deputed her assistant to handle client meetings
The sheriff deputed several citizens during the emergency

definitions: cause a train to leave its tracks accidentally or deliberately
prevent a plan or process from succeeding or continuing as intended
examples: The earthquake derailed the freight train near the station
Debris on the tracks could derail passing trains
Budget cuts derailed the new community center project
Personal problems derailed her promising athletic career

definitions: end the policy of racial segregation in schools or public places
examples: The Supreme Court ordered schools to desegregate in 1954
The city desegregated public buses after lengthy protests

definitions: officially assign a particular status or name to someone or something
examples: The board will designate a new chairman next month
The government designated the area as a national park

definitions: stop doing something or cease an activity especially by request or order
examples: The court ordered him to desist from contacting his ex-wife
Please desist from smoking in this non-smoking area immediately

definitions: make someone feel utterly wretched and unhappy especially through loss or abandonment
examples: The news of her friend's death desolated her completely
Years of war desolated families throughout the region

definitions: lose or be without hope especially when facing difficulties
examples: Don't despair when facing temporary setbacks in your career
Parents despaired of ever finding their missing child

definitions: send off to a destination or for a purpose quickly
examples: The company despatched the urgent order by express delivery
The general despatched reinforcements to the battlefield immediately

definitions: feel contempt or a deep repugnance for someone or something
examples: She despises people who are cruel to animals
Many citizens despise politicians who break their campaign promises

definitions: upset the stability of something causing it to become less secure
examples: Economic sanctions destabilised the country's financial system significantly
Rumours can destabilise even the strongest business partnerships

definitions: upset the stability of something causing it to become less secure
examples: Political unrest destabilized the entire region for months
High winds can destabilize tall construction cranes

definitions: cause deliberate destruction of something especially by explosion
examples: The missile will destruct if it goes off course
The company had to destruct defective products for safety

definitions: disconnect and separate something from something else it was attached to
examples: Please detach the coupon before mailing your payment
The soldier detached the scope from his rifle for cleaning

definitions: keep someone from proceeding by holding them back or making them late
examples: Security detained the suspicious visitor for further questioning
Bad weather detained our flight for several hours
